posts.post_content: Beautiful SGC 40 Speaker for sale. SOLD

Very disappointing to see this card on eBay last night offered for sale for $200 more than was paid here.  I wanted this card for my collection but was 60 minutes too late.  My loss.  But a $200 markup? Disappointing.

Just for the record, I also was apparently minutes late in trying to acquire this T206 speaker, and this card was not sold to me.

I also wanted the card for my personal collection.

[quote name="BlueDevil89" post=1681122]Just for the record, I also was apparently minutes late in trying to acquire this T206 speaker, and this card was not sold to me.

I also wanted the card for my personal collection.[/QUOTE]

Thanks for the clarification.  I had placed you on my NEVER DEAL WITH LIST based on the impression you were flipping this for a $200 profit.  I'll never deal with the eBay seller though.

[quote name="BleedinBlue" post=1681127]Thanks for the clarification.  I had placed you on my NEVER DEAL WITH LIST based on the impression you were flipping this for a $200 profit.  I'll never deal with the eBay seller though.[/QUOTE]

Wow.  Please add me to this list. Congrats to the buyer.  Apparently you got a great deal on a nice looking card.

[quote name="BleedinBlue" post=1681127]Thanks for the clarification.  I had placed you on my NEVER DEAL WITH LIST based on the impression you were flipping this for a $200 profit.  I'll never deal with the eBay seller though.[/QUOTE]

Not surprised considering the flipping nature of the hobby nowadays.  I will also add the ebay seller to my list of not to purchase from.
listing a card for sale isnt flipping it...if actually sells the card for a $200 profit then thats real profit....if he listed the card for a $3000 profit....again its not profit until its sold

[quote name="1952boyntoncollector" post=1681694]listing a card for sale isnt flipping it...if actually sells the card for a $200 profit then thats real profit....if he listed the card for a $3000 profit....again its not profit until its sold[/QUOTE]

Listing a card immediately for more than the purchase price would seem to indicate a flipper's intent to flip.

Keeping several thousand cards in their closet without listing them would seem to indicate a buyer's intent to collect.

Neither action is wrong, but they are different.
